Job Title: Staff Accountant (140813)

Location: Canton, MA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Our client, a distribution company in Canton MA, is seeking a Staff Accountant to join their growing team.

Salary/Hourly Rate

$70,000 – $80,000

Position Overview

The Staff Accountant will play a pivotal role in various accounting functions and contribute to the development and enhancement of our accounting practices. They’re seeking a detail-oriented, analytical, and customer service-focused Staff Accountant individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities Of The Staff Accountant

 Support the Accounting Manager in month-end activities, including journal entry preparation, GL account reconciliations, and bank reconciliations Assist in resolving Purchase Order (PO) and invoice discrepancies Aid in the daily operations of the Accounts Payable team, including vouchering, monitoring billing portals, and addressing AP inbox inquiries Collaborate with branch managers and suppliers to troubleshoot issues effectively Maintain State Sales Tax reconciliation and ensure monthly filings are completed accurately Serve as backup for accounts receivable and participate in cross-training within various accounting functions Provide assistance to external auditors by gathering necessary information and documents for annual audits Offer general support to the Accounting Department and undertake additional tasks as required

Qualifications For The Staff Accountant

 2+ years of experience in an Accounting Department Strong communication skills, meticulous attention to detail, and the ability to excel in a fast-paced setting Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (including VLOOKUPs, Pivot tables), Outlook, and Word Excellent analytical skills Experience with Epicor Prophet 21 ideal

Education Requirements

 Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business is required

Benefits

 401(k) with matching Dental insurance Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Vision insurance

 As a woman-owned firm, we value diversity. We are an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer and will consider all applications without regard to race, sex (including gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation and gender identity), age, color, religion or creed, national origin or ancestry, veteran status, disability (physical or mental), genetic information, citizenship or any other characteristic protected by law. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Candidates who apply for roles through the Atrium website will be added to our candidate pool and may be considered for additional roles of a similar title. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

EOE/M/F/D/V/SO 

Position ID: 140813

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
